title: Aarogya Setu
mainText: Unable to evaluate your risk status
subText: You must be under medical supervision
recommendText: See all steps to keep yourself & others safe
recommendationList: Take self assessment test every day
If you show symptoms, call helpline
Retake take self assessment test if you develop symtoms.
If you are not under medical care right now, please call the helpline immediately!
Please help to keep your community safe.
guideLines: Greet with a Namaste instead of a handshake

caution.title: CAUTION
caution.desc: Possibility of contact with an infected person in last 2 days, who was present within distance of 2m for 3min

epass.noEpassMessage: When issued, it will show up here

faqList.q: What information does my e-pass contain?
faqList.a: Your e-pass contains all the basic information about you, your company, supply chain partner, e-pass valid till date, location and nature of work.

faqList.q: Can my e-pass be used for other purposes than essential supply duty?
faqList.a: No. It should only be used for the essential supply purposes and if any citizen is caught misusing this pass then he/she would be liable for punishment.
The 6 digit unique alphanumeric ID mentioned on the e-pass is the e-pass number.

faqList.q: Is my e-pass valid at any location?
faqList.a: No. It is only valid in the Valid Location as mentioned in the e-pass.

faqList.q: Who is the issuing authority of my e-pass?
faqList.a: Every e-pass have the state government logo at the top which is the issuing authority of the e-pass.

faqList.q: How can my e-pass be verified?
faqList.a: You can scan your e-pass with any QR code scanner or you can send a SMS “VERIFY e-pass number” to 9686454890. For eg. “VERIFY jf7KTn”. If it is a valid e-pass number then you will receive an automated confirmation from the e-pass system.

faqList.q: Is my e-pass valid with any Government issued ID?
faqList.a: Yes. Your e-pass is valid on-ground only with the possession of any government issued ID like Aadhar Card, Voter ID Card, Driving License and PAN Card.

pmCares.quote: Aarogya Setu is an important step in our fight against COVID-19. By leveraging technology, it provides important information. As more and more people use it, it’s effectiveness will increase. I urge you all to download it.

list.p: Shows the number of Aarogya Setu users near you (within a radius of 500m to 10 kms), who have been active on the app – like checking their status, watching videos, doing self-assessment or checking COVID-19 stats. This does not show the number of people who have installed the app, that number would be higher.

Shows the number of users near you (within a radius of 500m to 10 kms) who have recently (in the last 24-48 hours) completed the self assessment test. This is not the number of active Aarogya Setu users.

Shows the number of users near you (within a radius of 500m to 10kms) who have recently (in the last 24-48 hours), completed the self assessment test – on the basis of which they have marked themselves as unwell.

Aarogya Setu App uses Bluetooth proximity (close-ness) tracing to highlight any possible risks users may have – by coming close (in proximity) to either a confirmed COVID-19 positive patient, or someone who is at a high risk. This number indicates all those who have been marked as 'At-risk' owing to such close contact – traced through Bluetooth. Their data and the data of those they came in contact with is still anonymous.

Shows the number of users near you (within a radius of 500m to 10 kms) who have been diagnosed as COVID-19 positive based on lab-test and confirmation by ICMR. If you have not come in contact with the user – your status will show as green and you have nothing to worry about. Just take the precautions and follow the 'things to do next'

items.text: Permanently cancel your Aarogya Setu registration.
Erase your app data from your phone.
Erase your information from government servers after 30 days.

subText.value: Deleting your app before deleting your account will delete your app data from your phone but not from the government servers.
